Pre-Game Insights: India hasn't challenged themselves by batting first after winning the toss in T20Is, which is considered unpardonable given the upcoming T20 World Cup.
India's last T20I before the T20 World Cup is a crucial game, but it is also a dead-rubber match far removed from any event of real significance.
Axar Patel has had an outstanding series with the ball, and Washington Sundar has had a tidy one, allowing India's top order to bat with freedom.
Afghanistan's hopes of breaking their T20I duck against India may rest on the shoulders of their most dangerous top-order batter, Rahmanullah Gurbaz.
India may give one or more of Sanju Samson, Kuldeep Yadav, and Avesh Khan a go in Bengaluru with the series already in the bag.
Qais Ahmad could get a look in for Afghanistan if they feel the need for a legspinner.
The M Chinnaswamy Stadium is known for its run-fests, but there have been times when the venue belied that reputation, influenced heavily by spinners recently.
The groundstaff have had plenty of time to prepare a fresh pitch for this game, so more typical Chinnaswamy conditions can be expected.
The forecast promises a clear, pleasant evening with temperatures in the mid-20s Celsius.
